$Log: pbs-server.xml,v $ Revision 1.23 2006/10/23 12:43:07 royd Fix for the service pack bug that actually works. Postpone the initialization until the first bootup since we cannot do it in post afterall because then the hostname is localhost which doesn't work with the administrator domains set in pbs.default. This should work for all future "evil" rolls that do insert-ethers --update during post after "chkconfig pbs_server on" is executed. This wouldn't be neccessary if everyone would use --norestart also, but that cannot be assumed.

/opt/rocks/bin/rocks set appliance attr compute pbs true
# # Create and define queue default # create queue default set queue default queue_type = Execution set queue default keep_completed = 120 set queue default enabled = True set queue default started = True # # Set server attributes. # set server scheduling = True set server acl_host_enable = False set server server_name = &Kickstart_PrivateHostname;.&Kickstart_PublicDNSDomain; set server managers = maui@&Kickstart_PrivateHostname;.&Kickstart_PublicDNSDomain; set server managers += maui@&Kickstart_PrivateHostname;.&Kickstart_PrivateDNSDomain; set server managers += root@&Kickstart_PrivateHostname;.&Kickstart_PublicDNSDomain; set server managers += root@&Kickstart_PrivateHostname;.&Kickstart_PrivateDNSDomain; set server default_queue = default set server log_events = 511 set server mail_from = adm set server query_other_jobs = True set server allow_node_submit = True set server moab_array_compatible = True
# make pbs_server listen on private interface
PBS_DAEMON="/opt/torque/sbin/pbs_server"
# initialize the queuing setup on first boot if [ -x /opt/torque/init_database ]; then sh /opt/torque/init_database chmod -x /opt/torque/init_database fi
#!/bin/sh
serverdb=/var/spool/torque/server_priv/serverdb if [ -e $serverdb ]; then echo "$serverdb already exists! Aborting initialization." echo "Remove $serverdb and try running $0 again." exit fi
export PATH+=":/opt/rocks/bin:/opt/torque/bin" /sbin/chkconfig --add pbs_server /sbin/chkconfig pbs_server on /sbin/service pbs_server create /sbin/service pbs_server start sleep 5 qmgr < /opt/torque/pbs.default rocks report pbsnodes | sh pbsnodes -l offline | awk '{print $1}' | xargs pbsnodes -c
*serverHosts: &Kickstart_PrivateHostname;.&Kickstart_PublicDNSDomain; *selectHosts: &Kickstart_PrivateHostname;.&Kickstart_PublicDNSDomain; *selectQueues: default@&Kickstart_PrivateHostname;.&Kickstart_PublicDNSDomain;
*sitesInfo: {Local;ICON;&Kickstart_PrivateHostname;.&Kickstart_PublicDNSDomain;;&Kickstart_PrivateHostname;.&Kickstart_PublicDNSDomain;;;;}
[DEFAULT] # set update_node_list to 0 if you do not want automatic updates # to the nodelist when you add or remove nodes. You will then have # to update the nodelist in /opt/torque/server_priv/nodes manually. update_node_list = 1
# add firewall rules to block external access to the pbs ports (CVE-2011-2907) rocks add firewall appliance=Frontend network=public protocol=udp service=15001 chain=INPUT action=REJECT rulename=R100-PBS_SERVER rocks add firewall appliance=Frontend network=public protocol=udp service=1023 chain=INPUT action=REJECT rulename=R110-PBS_SERVER rocks add firewall appliance=Frontend network=public protocol=tcp service=15001 chain=INPUT action=REJECT rulename=R105-PBS_SERVER
